dialogues.speaker: Yulva (implied)
dialogues.line: The Sealers' duty ends where suffering begins. I choose the poison I can cure over the darkness I cannot.
dialogues.context: Remedy sorcery hints at her abandonment of New Londo to heal Blighttown's suffering.

dialogues.speaker: Artorias (corrupted)
dialogues.context: His only 'dialogue' is through combat; his sword tells his story.

dialogues.speaker: Fire Keeper (corrupted)
dialogues.context: Gnawed by humanity, she is silent—her soul screams instead.

dialogues.speaker: Big Hat Logan
dialogues.line: Knowledge is power, but madness follows...
dialogues.context: Spoken after freeing him from Sen's Fortress, foreshadowing his fate.

dialogues.speaker: Seath the Scaleless
dialogues.context: His madness leaves him incapable of speech; crystals 'speak' for him.

dialogues.speaker: Crestfallen Warrior
dialogues.context: Warning to the player about losing purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Ingward
dialogues.line: The Abyss may yet be evaded...
dialogues.context: Spoken from New Londo's rooftops, clinging to hope.

dialogues.speaker: The Fair Lady
dialogues.context: Eingyi translates: 'She thanks you for your humanity.'

dialogues.speaker: Sif
dialogues.context: If met in the DLC first, recognizes the player and hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Dusk of Oolacile
dialogues.context: Misremembers the player's actions (originally Artorias' role).

dialogues.speaker: Solaire of Astora
dialogues.context: Iconic greeting; symbolizes perseverance.

dialogues.speaker: Velka (through items)
dialogues.context: Her talisman's description implies rebellion against the gods.

dialogues.speaker: Priscilla
dialogues.line: Thou must return whence thou camest.
dialogues.context: Offers mercy if the player leaves the Painted World.

dialogues.speaker: Quelana of Izalith
dialogues.context: Laments the Witch of Izalith's transformation.

dialogues.speaker: Darkmoon Knightess
dialogues.line: The gods have forsaken this city.
dialogues.context: Hints at Anor Londo's illusion when the firekeeper is killed.

dialogues.speaker: Gravelord Nito
dialogues.context: His 'voice' is the rattling of bones and miasma.

dialogues.speaker: Manus, Father of the Abyss
dialogues.context: His wild humanity 'speaks' through the Abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Gwyn, Lord of Cinder
dialogues.context: His fight has no dialogue—only desperation in his attacks.

dialogues.speaker: Frampt
dialogues.line: I am Kingseeker Frampt, close friend of Lord Gwyn!
dialogues.context: First meeting; his tone suggests deception.

dialogues.speaker: Kaathe
dialogues.line: The Dark Lord... that is thy true shape.
dialogues.context: Reveals the player's potential to usurp the Age of Fire.

dialogues.speaker: Havel the Rock
dialogues.context: Found trapped in a tower, wielding his iconic shield—his rage implies betrayal by the gods.

dialogues.speaker: Oscar of Astora
dialogues.line: Thou who art Undead, art chosen...
dialogues.context: First NPC to speak; delivers the game's core prophecy before dying.

dialogues.speaker: Laurentius of the Great Swamp
dialogues.line: Don't you dare go Hollow on me.
dialogues.context: Friendly warning if sent to Blighttown without proper pyromancy.

dialogues.speaker: Solaire of Astora
dialogues.line: If only I could be so grossly incandescent!
dialogues.context: Famous praise of the Sun; shows his unwavering idealism.

dialogues.speaker: Iron Tarkus
dialogues.context: His strength speaks through his armor crashing against the Iron Golem.

dialogues.speaker: Witch Beatrice
dialogues.context: Her summon sign hums with Oolacile sorceries—no direct dialogue.

dialogues.speaker: Darkstalker Kaathe
dialogues.line: The Dark Soul is thine heritage.
dialogues.context: Reveals humanity's true nature when encountered in the Abyss.

dialogues.speaker: The Fair Lady
dialogues.context: Eingyi translates: 'She accepts your offering, kind Undead.'

dialogues.speaker: Alvina of the Darkroot Wood
dialogues.context: Forest Hunter covenant leader threatens trespassers.

dialogues.speaker: Shiva of the East
dialogues.context: Hints at his greed before betraying the player for their gear.

dialogues.speaker: Patches
dialogues.line: Well, look who we have here!
dialogues.context: Classic trap dialogue before kicking the player off ledges.

dialogues.speaker: Gwynevere (Illusion)
dialogues.line: Hast thou the strength... to link the Fire?
dialogues.context: Gwyndolin's fabricated goddess nudges players toward Gwyn's agenda.

dialogues.speaker: Dark Sun Gwyndolin
dialogues.line: Thou shalt perish in the twilight of Anor Londo.
dialogues.context: Spoken during the boss fight; rejects those who see through the illusion.

dialogues.speaker: Mimic (Symbol of Avarice)
dialogues.context: Its 'dialogue' is the sound of its teeth snapping shut.

dialogues.speaker: Crossbreed Priscilla
dialogues.line: This land is peaceful, its inhabitants kind...
dialogues.context: Ironic, given the Painted World's horrors. Offers mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Gravelord Nito
dialogues.context: His 'voice' is the sound of death itself—no words needed.

dialogues.speaker: Frampt
dialogues.context: Urges the player to link the Fire, ignoring the cost.

dialogues.speaker: Undead Merchant (Male)
dialogues.context: Grumpy but harmless; sells moss for Blighttown.

dialogues.speaker: Undead Merchant (Female)
dialogues.context: Creepy laugh when selling the Uchigatana.

dialogues.speaker: Vamos the Blacksmith
dialogues.context: Skeptical of Undead, but forges Chaos weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Gough
dialogues.context: Blind giant archer in Oolacile; helps against Kalameet.

dialogues.speaker: Elizabeth (Mushroom)
dialogues.context: Oddly wholesome merchant in Oolacile's sanctuary.

dialogues.speaker: Marvelous Chester
dialogues.context: Bloodborne-esque hunter; implies time is convoluted.

dialogues.speaker: Hawkeye Gough
dialogues.line: I've seen your kind, time and time again...
dialogues.context: Hints at the cyclical nature of the Undead curse.

dialogues.speaker: Chosen Undead
dialogues.context: Actions (linking the Fire/walking away) are their 'dialogue.'
